body: When refering documentation, if possible, include the link to documentation

@rspadim, link to documentation is in error message:
https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/indexing.html#deprecate-loc-reindex-listlike

It says:

> Warning
> 
> Starting in 0.21.0, using .loc or [] with a list with one or more missing labels, is deprecated, in favor of .reindex.

So, in the function get evetns this part:
 ```
   # 1) Get target
    target = target.loc[t_events]
    target = target[target > min_ret]  # min_ret

```
according to documentation should be changed to:
```
    # 1) Get target
    target = target.reindex(t_events)
    target = target[target > min_ret]  # min_ret

```
The problem is that first operation produce Nan values (there are CUSUM events dates that are not in daily volume dates because daily_volume has Nan in the begining of the series). MAybe, it is also needed to delete Nan values:
```
# 1) Get target
    target = target.reindex(t_events).dropna()
```

Hi @MislavSag, 

This error is due to us not having ported the codebase to pandas 1.0.1, if you downgrade to before 1.0.0 then everything will work as expected.
We have added porting to pandas 1.0.1 to the todo items. :)

@Jackal08 

I'm going to make the adjustment to my personal version, but wanted to get clarification on, if there was any reason to keep the NaN by using reindex or if the function should keep only valid keys per the pandas example [link](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/indexing.html#indexing-with-list-with-missing-labels-is-deprecated).

Example from their docs below:
```
# current behavior
In [4]: s.loc[[1, 2, 3]]
Passing list-likes to .loc with any non-matching elements will raise
KeyError in the future, you can use .reindex() as an alternative.

See the documentation here:
https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/indexing.html#deprecate-loc-reindex-listlike

Out[4]:
1    2.0
2    3.0
3    NaN
dtype: float64

#=========================
# reindex

In [101]: s.reindex([1, 2, 3])
Out[101]: 
1    2.0
2    3.0
3    NaN
dtype: float64

#=========================
# intersection

In [102]: labels = [1, 2, 3]

In [103]: s.loc[s.index.intersection(labels)]
Out[103]: 
1    2
2    3
dtype: int64

```

issue.title: MlFinLab packages versions update

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

In this PR:
- The packages that MlFinLab is using are updated to the latest versions:
  - pandas: 0.25.3 -> 1.0.4
  - numpy: 1.17.3 -> 1.18.5
  - scikit-learn: 0.21.3 -> 0.23.1
  - scipy: 1.3.1 -> 1.4.1
  - matplotlib: 3.1.1 -> 3.2.1
  - cvxpy: 1.0.25 -> 1.1.1
- Travis CI build process is updated:
  - Now pylint shows only important results output and raw metrics tables (no dependency tree and unneeded tables)
  - All Warnings and leaked Errors during unit tests were fixed
  - During the build, only the errors in tests are displayed without unnecessary prints from test functions
  - Previous unit tests + coverage procedure was replaced by only coverage since errors in unit tests will anyways show during coverage test
  - Build time decreased from 40 minutes to 24 minutes
- Some unit tests were adjusted to decrease testing time and adjust to new versions of packages
- Functions that use multiprocessing (labeling, sample weights, sb_bagging, structural breaks) now have an option to silence the report of progress on asynch jobs
- Documentation issues were fixed
- All sphinx warnings were fixed
- Small imbalance sample dataset added


Fixes #190, #197, #228, #249, #313, #335, #356, #358, 

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

# How Has This Been Tested?

The following changes were tested on all previous MlFinLab unit tests.

Unit test values were changed only if the method algorithms was changed in the used package (mostly scikit-learn's RandomForestClassifier and BaggingClassifier functions). Or if the test dataset was decreased to improve testing time.

**Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* PyCharm

# Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

body:
Hi @MislavSag, 

We have updated all the packages and are doing a version release this weekend. That includes updating all our code to work with the new packages. 

I am going to close this issue but if you had an additional bug fix included or fixes to docstrings, please do reopen it or ping me in Slack. 

Best regards
Jacques

Hi @Jackal08 ,

that's great news. Can't wait to test new versions.

Best,

Mislav
